content.description: Believe it or not, the crux of this route is the vert crawl leading up to the big roof feature.  Thankfully its bolted, though the bolts seem to be in the wrong spot.  The roof on the other hand happily eats gear and is super easy as long as you can manage a heel hook or two and a mantle of sorts.  Good gear awaits above but the climbing gets tricky heading for the chains.  This is a super fun route!  Go do it!
content.protection: 3 bolts and a standard rack of wires and cams gets the job done.
content.location: This route is on the East wall roughly across from the other four sport routes.  It goes through the big roof.

content.description: Pick your way up the crack system that heads up and slightly left.  After 4 or 5 clips you'll have to step right and go through a steeper section.  The route becomes increasingly harder and harder to read from here on.  A great route all in all
content.location: The second bolted line roughly following a left angling crack system.

content.description: Climb the black streak through good edges.
content.location: First bolted line as you approach the Area

content.description: Though there are a few jugs and good clipping holds, this route is thin and demanding the entire way.  The crux is high up and could easily be .12- if you climb directly through it.  A great route in a cool setting.
content.location: Begin as with String Theory but after the first bolt step right.

content.description: The rock is a little questionable starting out but changes to typical bullet hard and solid granite by the second clip.  Sack up or stick clip it, this route is cool and will test your crimp strength and route reading skills.
content.location: The right most route, beginning up the technicolored rock.
